page.title: 04HALLATON TRANSPORT
page.content: Most families in Hallaton have at least one car: this is essential if working outside the village. The railway line which used to serve Hallaton closed in 1961, and there are bus services into Market Harborough on only two days of the week, on Tuesdays (two buses) and Saturdays. There is also a bus to Leicester on every second Wednesday of the month, and the garage runs a taxi service on request. There is quite a number of elderly people and farm workers in particular who have no transport of their own, and housewives with no car for daytime use. Although this causes some inconvenience, it does help to make Hallaton feel more like a village rather than a commuter outpost of Leicester.
